{|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image | Ship image = | Ship caption = }} {{Infobox ship career | Hide header = | Ship name = ''Empire Dew'' | Ship owner = Ministry of War Transport | Ship operator = | Ship registry = {{flagicon|United Kingdom|civil}} Greenock, United Kingdom | Ship route = | Ship ordered = | Ship builder = Lithgows Ltd | Ship original cost = | Ship yard number = 940 | Ship way number = | Ship laid down = | Ship launched = 21 November 1940 | Ship completed = January 1941 | Ship commissioned = | Ship decommissioned = | Ship christened = | Ship acquired = | Ship maiden voyage = 2 February 1941 | Ship in service = | Ship out of service = 12 June 1941 | Ship identification =*United Kingdom Official Number 166993 *Code Letters GPFM *{{ICS|Golf}}{{ICS|Papa}}{{ICS|Foxtrot}}{{ICS|Mike}} | Ship fate = Torpedoed and sunk | Ship status = | Ship notes = }} {{Infobox ship characteristics | Hide header = | Header caption = | Ship class = Cargo ship | Ship tonnage =*{{GRT|7,005}} *{{NRT|5,135}}<!-- *x,xxx [[deadweight tonnage|DWT]]--> | Ship displacement = | Ship length = {{convert|432|ft|0|in|m|2|abbr=on}} | Ship beam = {{convert|56|ft|2|in|m|2|abbr=on}} | Ship height = | Ship draught = {{convert|26|ft|4|in|m|2|abbr=on}} | Ship depth = {{convert|34|ft|2|in|m|2|abbr=on}} | Ship decks = | Ship deck clearance = | Ship ramps = | Ship ice class = | Ship range = | Ship power = {{convert|436|ihp|kW|abbr=on}} | Ship propulsion = Triple expansion steam engine | Ship speed = <!--{{convert|11.5|kn|km/h}}--> | Ship capacity = | Ship crew = 42 (including [[Defensively Equipped Merchant Ship|DEMS]] gunners) | Ship notes = | Ship armament = }} |} {{location map|North Atlantic|width=304 |lat=51.15 |long=-30.267 |caption=Location where ''Empire Dew'' was torpedoed. }}
'''''Empire Dew''''' was a {{GRT|7,005}} [[Cargo ship]] that was built in 1940 by [[Lithgows|Lithgows Ltd]], [[Port Glasgow]], [[United Kingdom]] for the [[Ministry of War Transport]] (MoWT) . She was torpedoed and sunk by {{GS|U-48|1939|2}} in 1941.
==Description== The ship was built in 1940 by [[Lithgows|Lithgows Ltd]], [[Port Glasgow]].<ref name=Ships>{{cite book |last1= Mitchell |first1=W.H. |last2=Sawyer |first2=L.A. |year=1995 |title=The Empire Ships |page=not cited |publisher= Lloyd's of London Press Ltd |location= London, New York, Hamburg, Hong Kong |isbn=1-85044-275-4}}</ref> She was yard number 940.<ref name=Clydesite>{{cite web |url=http://www.clydesite.co.uk/clydebuilt/viewship.asp?id=18265 |title=Launched 1940: ss EMPIRE DEW |publisher=Clydesite |accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref>
The ship was {{convert|432|ft|0|in|m|2}} long, with a beam of {{convert|56|ft|2|in|m|2}}. She had a depth of {{convert|34|ft|2|in|m|2}} and a draught of {{convert|26|ft|3|in|m|2}}. She was assessed at {{GRT|7,005}}. {{NRT|5,135}}.<ref name=Dew40>{{cite web|url=http://www.plimsollshipdata.org/pdffile.php?name=40a1060.pdf |title=LLOYD'S REGISTER, NAVIRES A VAPEUR ET A MOTEURS |publisher=Plimsoll Ship Data |accessdate=15 July 2011}}</ref><!-- Her [[deadweight tonnage|DWT]] was x,xxx.<ref name=xxxx/>-->
The ship was propelled by a {{convert|436|ihp|kW}} [[triple expansion steam engine]], which had cylinders of {{convert|23+1/2|in|cm}}, {{convert|37+1/2|in|cm}} and {{convert|68|in|cm}} diameter by {{convert|48|in|cm}} stroke. The engine was built by Rankin & Blackmore Ltd, [[Greenock]].<ref name=Dew40/><!-- It drove a screw propeller and could propel the ship at {{convert|xx|kn|km/h}}.<ref name=xxxx/>-->
==History== ''Empire Dew'' was built for the MoWT. Launched on 21 November 1940, she was completed in January 1941.<ref name=Ships/> She was placed under the management of R Chapman & Son Ltd, [[Newcastle-upon-Tyne]].<ref name=Uboat>{{cite web |url=http://www.uboat.net/allies/merchants/ships/990.html |title=Empire Dew |publisher=Uboat |accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref> The Official Number 166993 and [[Code Letters]] GPFM were allocated.<ref name=Dew40/> Her port of registry was [[Greenock]].<ref name=Benjidog>{{cite web |url=http://www.benjidog.co.uk/Tower%20Hill/Empire%20Day%20to%20Empire%20Engineer.html |title=Empire Day to Empire Engineer |publisher=Brian Watson |accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref>
''Empire Dew'' departed from the [[River Clyde|Clyde]] on her [[maiden voyage]] on 2 February 1941 as a member of Convoy OB 281, which departed from [[Liverpool]], [[Lancashire]] on 1 February and dispersed at sea on 5 February.<ref name=OB281>{{cite web |url=http://www.convoyweb.org.uk/ob2/index.html?ob.php?convoy=281!~obmain |title=Convoy OB.281 |publisher=Convoyweb |accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref> Her destination was [[Halifax Regional Municipality|Halifax]], [[Nova Scotia]], [[Canada]], where she arrived on 24 February.<ref name=Port>{{cite web |url=http://convoyweb.org.uk/ports/index.html?search.php?vessel=EMPIRE%20DEW~armain |title=EMPIRE DEW |publisher=Convoyweb |accessdate=28 May 2011}}</ref> From Halifax, a return trip was made to [[Saint John, New Brunswick]], arriving back at Halifax on 10 March.<ref name=Port/> ''Empire Dew'' was a member of [[Convoy SC 26]], which departed from Halifax on 20 March and arrived at Liverpool on 8 April. She was carrying a cargo of [[flour]] destined for [[Leith]], [[East Lothian]].<ref name=SC26>{{cite web |url=http://www.warsailors.com/convoys/sc26.html |title=CONVOY SC 26 |publisher=Warsailors |accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref> She left the convoy at the Clyde on 8 April.<ref name=Port/> ''Empire Dew'' was a member of Convoy WN 114, which departed from the Clyde on 13 April and arrived at [[Methil]], [[Fife]] on 16 April.<ref name=WN114>{{cite web |url=http://www.convoyweb.org.uk/wn/index.html?wn.php?convoy=114!~wnmain |title=Convoy WN.114 |publisher=Convoyweb |accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref> She departed from Methil on 28 April as a member of Convoy FS 475, which arrived at [[Southend-on-Sea|Southend]], [[Essex]] on 30 April.<ref name=FS475>{{cite web |url=http://www.convoyweb.org.uk/fs/index.html?fs.php?convoy=0475!~fsmain |title=Convoy FS.475 = Convoy FS.75 / Phase 5 |publisher=Convoyweb |accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref>
''Empire Dew'' was a member of Convoy EC 27, which departed from Southend on 31 May and arrived at the Clyde on 6 June.<ref name=EC27>{{cite web |url=http://www.convoyweb.org.uk/ec/index.html?ec.php?convoy=27!~ecmain |title=Convoy EC.27 |publisher=Convoyweb |accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref> She left the convoy at [[Oban]], [[Argyllshire]] on 5 June, to join Convoy OG 64,<ref name=Port/> which departed from Liverpool on 4 June and arrived at [[Gibraltar]] on 18 June.<ref name=OG64>{{cite web |url=http://www.convoyweb.org.uk/og/index.html?og.php?convoy=64!~ogmain |title=Convoy OG.64 |publisher=Convoyweb |accessdate=15 June 2011}}</ref> She detached from the convoy and headed for [[Father Point]], [[New Brunswick]], Canada.<ref name=Uboat/> Her intended destination was [[Montreal]].<ref name=OG64/>
At 02:51 (German time) on 12 June, ''Empire Dew'' was torpedoed when north of the [[Azores]], [[Portugal]] ({{coord|51|09|N|30|16|W|display=inline, title}}) by {{GS|U-48|1939|2}}, under the command of [[Herbert Schulze]]. 23 crew members died. Seventeen crew and two [[Defensively Equipped Merchant Ship|DEMS]] gunners were rescued by {{HNoMS|St. Albans|I15|6}}. They were landed at Liverpool.<ref name=Uboat/> Those killed serving on ''Empire Dew'' are commemorated on the [[Tower Hill Memorial]], London.<ref name=Benjidog/>
